intro: Hemizygia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub with palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a star, is edible and has a tangy, acidic flavor. Hemizygia madagascariensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
